Sub: Peak hour management by CASOs and Gazetted Officers: Reg:-

Reference is made to the instructions issued vide this HQ fetter No O-
4201 1/APC/OPS(2)/Circular/08/12314 dated 28.11.2008 and No.O-
4201 1/APC/OPS(2)/Circular/AS/09-3923 dated 22.04.2010 regarding peak hour
operation and management of SHAs.
02 = The Director General, Gist nas repeatedly commented about the absence of
GOs during peak hours and has directed that all CASOs will ensure the Presence of a
Gazetted Officer during peak hours.
03 Hence, it is directed:

() For small AC headed ASGs: CASOs will himself be present during all flight
times.

(ii) Eor DC headed ASGs: CASO himself should be present in the SHA during
peak hours and other important flight times to supervise operations.

(iii) For Comdt. headed ASGs: CASO should endeavor to be present during peak
hours. if for any reasons, such arrangement is not Possible, during odd hours
or flight operations of International flights during night, it should be a divided
responsibility between the CASO and unit 2 /C. CASO will be responsible for
ensuing presence of a GO during peak times.

(iv) In DIG headed ASGs: Commandant/DC should be detailed for peak hour
supervision every day. The CASO (DIG) should, however, at least on a weekly
basis be present to monitor peak hour management by the Officer(s) and take
suitable corrective action wherever and whenever necessary.

04 Zonal DisG should ensure strict compliance of the above instructions by all
CASOs concerned and conduct checks through their CIW to ensure compliance.
